H0.text: Echo is the phenomenon that occurs when sound is reflected off an object.

H1.text: Signal is sound that is reflected off an object.

H2.text: Amplification is what it is called when sound is reflected off an object.

H3.text: Reverberation is what it is called when sound is reflected off an object.

A4.text: reverberation is often created when a sound is reflected on surfaces, causing multiple reflections that build up and then decay as the sound is absorbed by the surfaces of objects in the space.

A5.text: distinct echo is detectable at a minimum of 50 to 100 ms after the previous sound.

A6.text: A database of measured room impulse responses to generate realistic reverberation effects
